newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo Motor in tie-up with Renault on engines.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo Motor in tie-up with Renault on engines.

text.p: South Korean carmaker Daewoo Motor Co said on Friday it had formed a technical tie-up with France's Renault SA to produce about 500,000 engines for four Renault models per year from the middle of 1999.
The technical tie-up contract was signed in Paris between Kim Woo-choong, founding chairman of the Daewoo Group, and Renault chairman Louis Schweizer, a Daewoo statement said.
It said Daewoo plans to produce the engines in its domestic and overseas plants and build them into cars now being produced at its overseas factories.
Daewoo also agreed to buy 200,000 diesel engines from Renault between late 1998 and 2002, and plans to build them into cars being produced at Daewoo's overseas factories, it said.
The signing of the contract was also announced in Paris overnight.
